natural problem:
Let $a,$ $b,$ and $c$ be distinct real numbers.  Find the degree of the polynomial
\[p(x) = \frac{(x - b)(x - c)}{(a - b)(a - c)} + \frac{(x - a)(x - c)}{(b - a)(b - c)} + \frac{(x - a)(x - b)}{(c - a)(c - b)}.\]
natural solution: Note that $p(x)$ has degree at most 2. Also, $p(a) = p(b) = p(c) = 1.$  Thus, the polynomials $p(x)$ and 1 agree at three different values, so by the Identity Theorem, they are the same polynomial.

Hence, the degree of $p(x)$ (which is the constant polynomial 1) is $\boxed{0}.$ You can check manually that \[p(x) = \frac{(x - b)(x - c)}{(a - b)(a - c)} + \frac{(x - a)(x - c)}{(b - a)(b - c)} + \frac{(x - a)(x - b)}{(c - a)(c - b)}\]simplifies to 1.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c x :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "a \<noteq> b"
and h1 : "a \<noteq> c"
and h2 : "b \<noteq> c"
and h3 : "\<forall>x. p x = ((x - b) * (x - c) / ((a - b) * (a - c))) + ((x - a) * (x - c) / ((b - a) * (b - c))) + ((x - a) * (x - b) / ((c - a) * (c - b)))"
shows  "degree (p_poly p x) = 0"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a,$ $b,$ and $c$ be distinct real numbers.  Find the degree of the polynomial
\[p(x) = \frac{(x - b)(x - c)}{(a - b)(a - c)} + \frac{(x - a)(x - c)}{(b - a)(b - c)} + \frac{(x - a)(x - b)}{(c - a)(c - b)}.\] The final Answer is 0
 ### Proof
 Note that $p(x)$ has degree at most 2. Also, $p(a) = p(b) = p(c) = 1.$  Thus, the polynomials $p(x)$ and 1 agree at three different values, so by the Identity Theorem, they are the same polynomial.
 Hence, the degree of $p(x)$ (which is the constant polynomial 1) is $\boxed{0}.$ You can check manually that \[p(x) = \frac{(x - b)(x - c)}{(a - b)(a - c)} + \frac{(x - a)(x - c)}{(b - a)(b - c)} + \frac{(x - a)(x - b)}{(c - a)(c - b)}\]simplifies to 1.
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c x :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "a \<noteq> b"
and h1 : "a \<noteq> c"
and h2 : "b \<noteq> c"
and h3 : "\<forall>x. p x = ((x - b) * (x - c) / ((a - b) * (a - c))) + ((x - a) * (x - c) / ((b - a) * (b - c))) + ((x - a) * (x - b) / ((c - a) * (c - b)))"
shows  "degree (p_poly p x) = 0"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

The final answer is $0$.
